channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Trump says Venezuelan airspace should be considered closed
US State Department stops processing visas for Afghan allies
Mexico plans to build Latin America’s most powerful supercomputer
Showdown with Mexican billionaire Salinas tests Sheinbaum's power
Trump says he may cut income tax 'completely' because of tariff income
Trump administration to carry out sweeping immigration review after National Guard shooting
National Guard member dies as ambush in US capital becomes political flashpoint

US budget deficit hits $284b in October
Trump begins process of labeling Muslim Brotherhood chapters as terrorist
DOGE 'doesn't exist' with eight months left on its charter
Brazil's ex-president Bolsonaro detained by police ahead of vigil
Netanyahu officially asks Israeli president for pardon
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has submitted an official request for his pardon to Israeli President Isaac Herzog, the Israeli president's office said on Sunday. item.title: Rahul, Sonia Gandhi face conspiracy charges in National Herald case
item.description: Rahul Gandhi and his mother Sonia Gandhi have been booked on charges of criminal conspiracy in a fresh FIR in connection with the National Herald money laundering case, Indian media report. Filed by the Delhi Police’s Economic Offences Wing (EOW), and registered on Oct 3, the FIR names six i

item.title: Myanmar citizens abroad ‘welcome to return’, junta chief says
item.description: Myanmar junta leader has said citizens living in the United States and other countries will be welcomed if they wish to return. The announcement came after the United States ended temporary protected status for nearly 4,000 Myanmar nationals earlier this week. Irrawaddy reported that speaking at

item.title: Myanmar junta invites citizens abroad to return
item.description: Myanmar junta leader has said citizens living in the United States and other countries will be welcomed if they wish to return. item.title: Indonesia flood death toll climbs to 303 amid cyclone devastation, disaster agency says
item.description: The death toll from floods and landslides following cyclonic rains in the Indonesian island of Sumatra has risen to 303, the head of the country's disaster mitigation agency said on Saturday, up from a previous figure of 174 dead. Large parts of Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand have been stricken

item.title: How does the Hong Kong tower fire compare to other recent building blazes?
item.description:
A blaze that ripped through a massive apartment block in Hong Kong has claimed at least 128 lives, with 150 people still missing, surpassing the toll of a similar incident at London's Grenfell Tower in 2017.
Here is how the disaster compares to some other major building fire incidents arou

item.title: Hong Kong mourns victims of blaze that killed 128 and counting
item.description: Hong Kong on Saturday mourned the 128 people known to have died in a massive fire at a high-rise apartment complex, a toll that is likely to rise with 150 still missing days after the disaster.Authorities have arrested 11 people in connection with the city's worst blaze in nearly 80 years as they i

item.title: Nepal issues new Rs 100 note showing ‘Indian territories’
item.description: Nepal’s central bank on Thursday unveiled new Rs 100 currency notes featuring a revised national map that includes the disputed Kalapani, Lipulekh, and Limpiyadhura regions, territories India has long maintained are its own, reports The Times of India. The move revives a years-long boundary

item.title: Death toll from Hong Kong’s fire rises to 128
item.description: Hong Kong on Saturday mourned the 128 people known to have died in a massive fire at a high-rise apartment complex, a toll that is likely to rise, with 200 others still unaccounted for days after the disaster. Authorities have arrested 11 people in connection with the city's worst blaze in nearly

item.title: Israeli raid in southern Syria leaves 13 dead
item.description: Thirteen people were killed in an Israeli raid in southern Syria on Friday, Syrian state media reported, with Damascus accusing Israel of a "criminal attack" in a village where Israel said its troops came under fire during an operation to arrest militants. item.title: UAE halts visas for Pakistanis
item.description: The United Arab Emirates (UAE) has stopped issuing visas to Pakistani citizens, Interior Ministry official Salman Chaudhry has told a Senate committee, citing concerns over “misuse” of visit visas. Dawn reported Chaudhry’s remarks to the Senate Functional Committee on Human Right

item.title: Venezuela revokes flight rights for six airlines amid escalating US tensions
item.description: Venezuela has revoked operating rights for six major international airlines which suspended flights to the country following a warning from the US Federal Aviation Administration. The civil aviation authority revoked permits for Iberia, TAP, Avianca, Latam Colombia, Turkish Airlines and Gol, which
